bibl.note: This is a letter to David Henley from James Robertson, dated March 13, 1795. Robertson informs Henley of a split between the Creek and Chickasaw Nations. Chickasaw Chief Pio Mingo has asked for assistance. Robertson approves of the idea to build a fort upon the Tennessee River.

div1.p: Maj. Tatum is now about starting and I just this minute recd an express from Pio mingo & other chiefs furnishing certain information of a rupture between the Chickasaws & Creeks Assistance from the United States on the part of the Chickasaw is strenuously solicited__ It is suggested to me by the Chiefs that if a post is established upon the Tennessee, it well answer the purposes of offence and defence most effectually__ This Idea entirely coincides with mine, and suffer me to observe that if the U States think proper to afford them any assistance the sooner it is done, the better both for them and us__ To want of more time I refer you to the Gov for further information
